thread.title: APNewsBreak: De Blasio, Bloomberg to make peace at meeting
thread.title_full: APNewsBreak: De Blasio, Bloomberg to make peace at meeting - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: APNewsBreak: De Blasio, Bloomberg to make peace at meeting
text:
By JONATHAN LEMIRE
Associated Press NEW YORK (AP) - New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio and his predecessor Michael Bloomberg are planning to make peace.
Two people briefed on the plan but not authorized to speak publicly on the matter told The Associated Press on Thursday that De Blasio and Bloomberg will hold a joint news conference Oct 21.
They will plant the millionth tree of the Million Trees NYC program that Bloomberg launched in 2007 to improve the quality of life on the city's streets.
The two men appeared together in June at the groundbreaking for a tech campus, but the two people say this month's event is designed specifically as a show of camaraderie.
De Blasio was elected mayor in 2013 on a campaign that was fiercely critical of Bloomberg.
Bloomberg has largely stayed silent about his successor.
